reviewText: You ever watch a movie and the main character is extremely annoying? This is it! Skye McCole Bartusiak plays the main character a lazy writer want-a-be newly wed. She (as expected) is nosey but she also plays off as some cutesy air headed Cali girl. This movie has a ridiculously low budget in every aspect. Skye does a terrible job over-acting at every opportunity. The make-up and special effects are beyond terrible. Dont waste your money on this stinker.
summary: Sick Boy and odd Zombie type move - review

reviewText: this movie is a decent movie to watch if you are into horror movies. I liked it, but I think they could have done a whole lot more with this movie, definitely better than what it is. I picked it up at a local blockbuster that was closing for 3.99 and the disc was almost mint condition. It was worth the 4 dollars in my opinion, but not much more than that
Title: N/A

reviewText: What drew me was that Ms. Rochon was in it - been a fan of hers for some time.  Zombie babies - hate those, too sick to be scary, zombie kids - oh yeah, big creepy factor.  So they nailed it with the zombie kid part and the suspense and progression towards the reveal and the eventual climax action was good - but here is where the drawback part, comes in.  Every one played their respective role well - maybe, too well.  The female lead in this is so bloody OCD and screechy over-reactive and dare I say, dumb,  on almost everything you can think of, that I was looking forward to what I hoped, would be the end.  The film spent much wasted time setting up for the last 20 minutes of the movie that you wanna FFW the remote button to death to get away from this chick.  This time could have been so much better used, with less on her, more shifting or weird sounds, maybe rotted finger grappling under the door bottom edge and some better Rochon use to develop the tension of the back story - instead, we get a Jerry Springer show candidate with dialogue that just-don't -end!  Okay, getting that off my chest...once things start to line up I really got into this very well and got my zombie on.  So not a bad made film, not in anyway --- but you gotta have a high patience ability, to get where you want to be here.
summary: very good, but with a drawback
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't know why people gave this five stars.Some would say they are pluggers for the movie and that could very well be true.Well I've watched a horror movie once or twice and this is no five stars.I gave it two and I'm not sure if the second star was doled out because of pity or temporary insanity.The acting especially the boyfriend and the friend are the worst and are quite one dimensional.The plot is full of moments where you have to wonder what the hell is going on and who would do the things they do in this movie.Four hundred dollars for watching a kid who is in his room in the basement and which as  part of your orders, you are told never to go down and look in on him. That's right four bills to do nothing but eat strangers food.Sound to good to be true?Well to me it sounds retarded.I just can't follow the logic in this movie at all.Now here a nice spoiler alert for those of you who may still wish to rent this...go rent it and stop reading this.For the rest who are like well if I had an idea of what this movie is about maybe I'd rent it and don't mind a spoiler here it is:The sick boy is a ZOMBIE!!! WOW that's original.That's right another low budget zombie movie which means it has all been done before and then done again.Hey five star people what would you rate a movie that is actually good..like a thousand stars?I mean if by your standards this is a five then a good movie like let's say District 9 must be in the triple digits.Seriously, you could probalby live not having seen this movie... I know I could've.

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: This is a low budget film that has a lot of filler material. Lucy (Skye McCole Bartusiak) lands a job as a high priced babysitter because she can't act. She babysits for a child locked up in his room which she is forbidden to go near. The job pays well and Lucy is curious.Most of the time building up to the last 17 minutes, when the film becomes interesting, is wasted. The film utilizes those cheap voice enhancers normally used for demonically possessed people. The whole scene of Lucy driving in a car listening to hip-hop was a waste. This would have been better as a 30 minute short feature.The ending is interesting and the film drops clues, but unfortunately the movie wakes up too close to the end.Parental Guide: F-bombs. No sex or nudity. 2 stars is generous.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was better than I thought it would be though it doesn't quite go as far as it could have.  The sick boy has an illness, all right, and it is spreading to his parents while his babysitter unravels the horror after just a couple of nights in his house.
summary: Not bad; a bit of a twist on the genre
